node.title: How do I know when I need a COVID-19 booster dose? And how do I prove I've had it?
node.alt: A blue-gloved hand holds a bottle of vaccine.
node.description: With almost 90 per cent of Australians over the age of 16 now fully vaccinated, booster doses are fast approaching. Here's what you need to know.
node.content:
["With almost 90 per cent of Australians over the age of 16 now fully vaccinated, booster doses are fast approaching.", "They're not mandatory, but they'll increase your protection against infection, severe disease and death.", "Here's what you need to know about the process.", "
Who is eligible to get a booster?
", "If you're\u00a018 years and older and received your second dose\u00a0of a COVID-19 vaccine\u00a0at least five\u00a0months ago, you're good to go.", "While booster shots aren't on the cards yet for those who are severely immunocompromised,\u00a0a\u00a0third primary dose of a COVID-19 vaccine is recommended two\u00a0months after your second dose (you can read more on that here).", "", "
Booster doses are\u00a0not mandatory, but they will increase your protection.(Shutterstock:\u00a0Marc Bruxelle)
", "
How do I know when I can get a booster?
", "The date you had your second vaccine dose\u00a0is on your COVID-19 digital certificate.", "Once you've passed the five-month mark, you can book in to receive a booster.", "
How do I book in to get a booster?
", "You can book booster doses through vaccination centres, or your GP or pharmacist.", "While some providers do accept walk-ins, others require a booking, so it's important to check beforehand.", "The federal government has a COVID-19 Clinic Finder, which allows you to filter by postcode and whether or not you've got a Medicare card.", "", "
This is what the COVID-19 Clinic Finder looks like.(Supplied: Department of Health)
", "Alternatively, click below for clinic locations in your state or territory:", "
What brand of booster can I get?
", "As it stands, the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines have been approved by the Therapeutic Goods Administration and are recommended by ATAGI as a booster dose.", "It's important to note that you're able to receive either vaccine as a booster, regardless of which vaccine you had for your first two doses.", "", "
You can get your booster if you're 18 years and older and received your second dose at least five\u00a0months ago.(ABC News: Haidarr Jones)
", "You're also able to receive the AstraZeneca vaccine if you:", "
How do I prove I've had a booster?
", "You'll find it on your digital vaccination certificate, which is updated when you receive each dose of vaccine.", "", "
You'll find proof of your booster on your digital vaccination certificate.(Supplied: Australian Digital Health Agency)
", "You can also find it in My Health Record, or in your Medicare account through:", "
Will I have to get another booster down the track?
", "The short answer is, we just don't know yet.", "According to the federal Health Department, it's not yet known how long the COVID-19 vaccine protection will last.", "\"Clinical trials are currently happening to find out if we will need booster doses on an annual or longer basis,\" it said.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
